html:
Dec 10 (Reuters) - The following are the top stories on the New York Times business pages. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.


- The U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Thursday authorized booster shots of the Pfizer Inc PFE.N and BioNTech 22UAy.DE coronavirus vaccine for another swathe of the population, 16- and 17-year-olds, at least six months after they received their second shot of that vaccine. https://nyti.ms/3pDAt1s


- Amazon AMZN.O on Thursday was fined nearly $1.3 billion by Italian regulators who accused the company of breaking antitrust laws by giving special perks to third-party merchants who use its warehouse and delivery system. https://nyti.ms/3oGdhAj


- American Airlines AAL.O said on Thursday that it would fly fewer international flights next summer than it had planned because it was waiting for Boeing BA.N to address quality concerns and restart delivering the 787 Dreamliner jet. https://nyti.ms/3DCmEFn


- The newspaper chain Lee Enterprises LEE.O announced on Thursday that it had rejected a takeover bid by the New York hedge fund Alden Global Capital, saying in a statement that the offer "grossly undervalues" the publisher of 90 dailies including The Buffalo News, The Omaha World-Herald and The St. Louis Post-Dispatch. https://nyti.ms/3DF6V8v


(Compiled by Bengaluru newsroom)

(( globalnewsmonitoring@thomsonreuters.com ))
